spanishExample: No creo que esas cosas existan en febrero del próximo año.
englishTranslation: I don’t think those things will exist in February of next year.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
existan: exist, they exist (Existir, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: La extrañamos todo este tiempo, pero vuelve el jueves.
englishTranslation: We missed her all this time, but she’s coming back on Thursday.
vocabIncluded: extrañamos: missed, we missed (Extrañar, preterite, 1st person plural)
vuelve: returns, he/she/it returns (Volver, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¿Olvidaste que ella se despierta a las nueve?
englishTranslation: Did you forget that she wakes up at nine?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
despierta: wakes up, he/she/it wakes up (despertar, present, 3rd person)
olvidaste: forgot, you forgot (Olvidar, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Solo podemos soñar porque eso dejará de existir en enero.
englishTranslation: We can only dream because that will stop existing in January.

spanishExample: Lo extraña mucho porque se fue en junio.
englishTranslation: She misses him a lot because he left in June.
vocabIncluded: extraña: misses, he/she/it misses (Extrañar, present, 3rd person)
irse: any use of Ir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to "leave"

spanishExample: He soñado lo mismo que él soñaba antes.
englishTranslation: I’ve dreamt the same (thing) that he was dreaming before.
vocabIncluded: "lo": "the" with no noun, as in "lo bueno"
he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)
soñaba: dreamt, he/she/it dreamt (Soñar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Olvídate de eso, necesito que se despierte temprano el martes.
englishTranslation: Forget about that; I need her to wake up early on Tuesday.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
despierte: wake up, he/she/it wake up (despertar, subjunctive, 3rd person)
necesito: need, I need (Necesitar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No quieren que lo olvide porque ya lo olvidé antes.
englishTranslation: They don’t want me to forget it because I already forgot it before.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
olvide: forget, I forget (Olvidar, subjunctive, 1st person)
olvidé: forgot, I forgot (Olvidar, preterite, 1st person)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Olvídalo; te extrañé mucho.
englishTranslation: Forget it; I missed you a lot.
vocabIncluded: extrañé: missed, I missed (Extrañar, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Solo estaremos ahí un rato.
englishTranslation: We’ll only be there a little while.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
estaremos: "will be", "we will be" (Estar, future, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Tienes que despertarte, pero él aún no se ha despertado.
englishTranslation: You have to wake up, but he still hasn’t woken up.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Ella lo extrañaba, pero la última vez que se vieron fue en agosto.
englishTranslation: She used to miss him, but the last time they saw each other was in August.
vocabIncluded: extrañaba: missed, he/she/it missed (Extrañar, imperfect, 3rd person)
vieron: saw, they saw (Ver, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Quieren que me despierte temprano el domingo.
englishTranslation: They want me to wake up early on Sunday.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
despierte: wake up, I wake up (despertar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Me gusta esa ropa para el otoño y te queda bien.
englishTranslation: I like that clothing for the Fall and it suits you well.
vocabIncluded: "bien": adverb meaning "well", "fine", and a variety of other positive things
gusta: likes, he/she/it likes (Gustar, present, 3rd person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
queda: remains, he/she/it remains (Quedar, present, 3rd person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: Soñé con él y él soñó conmigo.
englishTranslation: I dreamt about him and he dreamt about me.
vocabIncluded: soñé: dreamt, I dreamt (Soñar, preterite, 1st person)
soñó: dreamt, he/she/it dreamt (Soñar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No creo que eso exista ahora, pero ha existido antes.
englishTranslation: I don’t think that exists now, but it has existed before.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
exista: exist, he/she/it exist (Existir, subjunctive, 3rd person)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Ellos nos extrañan, así que iremos en otoño.
englishTranslation: They miss us, so we’ll go in the Fall.
vocabIncluded: extrañan: miss, they miss (Extrañar, present, 3rd person plural)
iremos: "will go", "we will go" (Ir, future, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Nos fuimos sin haberlos comido, pero volveremos el jueves.
englishTranslation: We left without having eaten them, but we’ll go back on Thursday.
vocabIncluded: irse: any use of Ir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to "leave"
volveremos: will return, we will return (Volver, future, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Te vamos a extrañar durante el verano. ¿Crees que volverás en abril?
englishTranslation: We’re going to miss you during the Summer. Do you think you’ll come back in April?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
crees: believe, you believe (Creer, present, 2nd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")
volverás: will return, you will return (Volver, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Te extrañaré en la fiesta del sábado, pero podemos vernos el viernes.
englishTranslation: I’ll miss you at the party on Saturday, but we can see each other on Friday.
vocabIncluded: del: "of the" before a masculine noun
extrañaré: will miss, I will miss (Extrañar, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: Creo que él soñaba contigo.
englishTranslation: I think he was dreaming about you.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
soñaba: dreamt, he/she/it dreamt (Soñar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: La extrañamos mucho porque se fue en mayo, pero vuelve el viernes.
englishTranslation: We miss her a lot because she left in May, but she’s coming back on Friday.
vocabIncluded: extrañamos: miss, we miss (Extrañar, present, 1st person plural)
irse: any use of Ir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to "leave"
vuelve: returns, he/she/it returns (Volver, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Pudiste haberme dicho eso cuando se despertaron.
englishTranslation: You could(preterite) have told me that when they woke up.
vocabIncluded: despertaron: woke up, they woke up(despertar, preterite, 3rd person plural)
pudiste: "were able / managed", "you were able / managed" (Poder, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: ¿Con qué estás soñando últimamente?
englishTranslation: What are you dreaming about lately?

spanishExample: Quiero que olvides por un rato lo que pasó el lunes.
englishTranslation: I want you to forget for a little while what happened on Monday.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
olvides: forget, you forget (Olvidar, subjunctive, 2nd person)
pasó: passed, he/she/it passed (Pasar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Podríamos habernos visto en diciembre, durante el verano.
englishTranslation: We could have seen each other in December, during the Summer.
vocabIncluded: podríamos: "would be able", "we would be able" (Poder, conditional, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: La primavera empieza el miércoles, y no quiero que él lo olvide.
englishTranslation: Spring starts on Wednesday, and I don’t want him to forget it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
empieza: starts, he/she/it starts (Empezar, present, 3rd person)
olvide: forget, he/she/it forget (Olvidar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Debería haberte hablado porque estos días sueño que me olvido de ellos.
englishTranslation: I should have talked to you because these days I’m dreaming that I forget about them.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
de used to mean "about", as in "hablar de"
olvido: forget, I forget (Olvidar, present, 1st person)
sueño: dream, I dream (Soñar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Lo hizo después de haberlo visto en noviembre porque lo extrañaba.
englishTranslation: She did it after having seen him in November because she was missing him.
vocabIncluded: extrañaba: missed, he/she/it missed (Extrañar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Vimos eso a través de la ventana, no lo olvide.
englishTranslation: We saw that via the window, (formal) don’t forget it.
vocabIncluded: vimos: saw, we saw (Ver, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: ¿Por qué te despiertas tan temprano los sábados?
englishTranslation: Why do you wake up so early on Saturdays?
vocabIncluded: despiertas: wake up, you wake up (despertar, present, 2nd person)
tan: "so" as an adverb right before an adjective or adverb

spanishExample: No, él todavía no se despertó.
englishTranslation: No, he didn’t wake up yet.
vocabIncluded: despertó: woke up, he/she/it woke up (despertar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Eso te queda muy bien, ¿vas a usarlo en otoño?
englishTranslation: That suits you really well, are you going to use it in the Fall?
vocabIncluded: "bien": adverb meaning "well", "fine", and a variety of other positive things
queda: remains, he/she/it remains (Quedar, present, 3rd person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: La última vez que nos vimos fue en septiembre y te extraño.
englishTranslation: The last time we saw each other was in September and I miss you.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
extraño: miss, I miss (Extrañar, present, 1st person)
vimos: saw, we saw (Ver, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Olvidó el principio de la historia, pero tú no has olvidado nada.
englishTranslation: He forgot the beginning of the story, but you haven't forgotten anything.
vocabIncluded: has: "have", "you have" before a participle (Haber, present, 2nd person)
olvidó: forgot, he/she/it forgot (Olvidar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¡Olvida eso! No sé por qué no lo quieres olvidar.
englishTranslation: Forget that! I don't know why you don’t want to forget it.

spanishExample: Me la dio después de haberla hecho porque si no se olvida.
englishTranslation: She gave it(f) to me after having made it(f) because if not she forgets.
vocabIncluded: me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")

spanishExample: Se alegra porque esas cosas solo existen en el invierno.
englishTranslation: He’s really glad because those things only exist in the Winter.
vocabIncluded: alegra: cheers up, he/she/it cheers up(alegrar, present, 3rd person)
existen: exist, they exist (Existir, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Deberías haberle dicho eso el miércoles y no el martes.
englishTranslation: You should have told her that on Wednesday and not on Tuesday.
vocabIncluded: deberías: should, you should (Deber, conditional, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Se alegró porque eso existía en junio.
englishTranslation: He was really glad because that existed in June.
vocabIncluded: alegró: cheered up, he/she/it cheered up (alegrar, preterite, 3rd person)
existía: existed, he/she/it existed (Existir, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¿Me extrañaste? Sabes que los domingos me despierto tarde.
englishTranslation: Did you miss me? You know that on Sundays I wake up late.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
despierto: wake up, I wake up (despertar, present, 1st person)
extrañaste: missed, you missed (Extrañar, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Lo supe a través de mis amigos y me alegro de saberlo.
englishTranslation: I found out via my friends and I’m really glad to know it.
vocabIncluded: alegro: cheer up, I cheer up (alegrar, present, 1st person)
supe: "knew / found out", "I knew / found out" (Saber, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Él podría haberse ido antes el lunes.
englishTranslation: He could have left earlier on Monday.
vocabIncluded: irse: any use of Ir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to "leave"
podría: "would be able", "he/she/it would be able" (Poder, conditional, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Me desperté tarde y no es mi culpa.
englishTranslation: I woke up late and it’s not my fault.
vocabIncluded: desperté: woke up, I woke up (despertar, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: No recuerdo el principio de la historia.
englishTranslation: I don’t remember the beginning of the story.
vocabIncluded: recuerdo:  remember/remind, I  remember/remind (Recordar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: El invierno es mi estación favorita.
englishTranslation: Winter is my favorite season.

spanishExample: Eso no existe, no lo olvides.
englishTranslation: That doesn’t exist, don’t forget it.
vocabIncluded: existe: exists, he/she/it exists (Existir, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Iremos en marzo o en octubre… lo sabremos el viernes.
englishTranslation: We’ll go in March or October… we’ll know on Friday.
vocabIncluded: "o": "or" when used between items in a list
iremos: "will go", "we will go" (Ir, future, 1st person plural)
sabremos: "will know", "we will know" (Saber, future, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Él se tiene que despertar cuando ellos se despierten.
englishTranslation: He has to wake up when they wake up.
vocabIncluded: despierten: wake up, they wake up (despertar, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Sueña con esa estación porque es su favorita.
englishTranslation: He dreams about that season because it’s his favorite.
vocabIncluded: sueña: dreams, he/she/it dreams (Soñar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No olvidaré eso, sé que me extrañas.
englishTranslation: I won’t forget that, I know you miss me.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
extrañas: miss, you miss (Extrañar, present, 2nd person)
olvidaré: will forget, I will forget (Olvidar, future, 1st person)
